title: PSRLDQ â€” Shift Double Quadword Right Logical

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`ib PSRLDQ xmm1, imm8`
`ib VPSRLDQ xmm1, xmm2, imm8`
`ib VPSRLDQ ymm1, ymm2, imm8`
`ib VPSRLDQ xmm1, xmm2/m128, imm8`
`ib VPSRLDQ ymm1, ymm2/m256, imm8`
`ib VPSRLDQ zmm1, zmm2/m512, imm8`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Shifts the destination operand (first operand) to the right by the number of bytes specified in the count operand (second operand). The empty high-order bytes are cleared (set to all 0s). If the value specified by the count operand is greater than 15, the destination operand is set to all 0s. The count operand is an 8-bit immediate.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: In 64-bit mode and not encoded with VEX/EVEX, using a REX prefix in the form of REX.R permits this instruction to access additional registers (XMM8-XMM15).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: 128-bit Legacy SSE version: The source and destination operands are the same. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding YMM destination register remain unchanged.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: The source and destination operands are XMM registers. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the destination YMM register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The source operand is a YMM register. The destination operand is a YMM register. The count operand applies to both the low and high 128-bit lanes.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The source operand is YMM register. The destination operand is an YMM register. Bits (MAXVL-1:256) of the corresponding ZMM register are zeroed. The count operand applies to both the low and high 128-bit lanes.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded versions: The source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register or a 512/256/128-bit memory location. The destination operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register. The count operand applies to each 128-bit lanes.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Note: VEX.vvvv/EVEX.vvvv encodes the destination register.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
